item.title: A concurrent resolution providing for a conditional adjournment or recess of the Senate and an adjournment of the House of Representatives.

latestAction.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

item.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Received in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S2551; text as passed Senate: CR S2551)
Passed/agreed to in Senate: Received in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S2551; text as passed Senate: CR S2551)
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 243 - 178 (Roll no. 269). (text: CR H2686)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 243 - 178 (Roll no. 269).(text: CR H2686)
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H2794)

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - The Chair put the question on agreeing to H.Con Res. 43 and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Moran demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings on agreeing to H.Con.Res. 43 until later in the legislative day.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H2686-2687)

summary.text:
Declares that when the House adjourns on the legislative day of Friday, April 15, 2011, or Saturday, April 16, 2011, it stand adjourned until 2 p.m. on Monday, May 2, 2011.

Declares that when the Senate recesses or adjourns on any day from Thursday, April 14, 2011, through Friday, April 29, 2011, it stand recessed or adjourned until noon on Monday, May 2, 2011.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Declares that when the House adjourns on the legislative day of Friday, April 15, 2011, or Saturday, April 16, 2011, it stand adjourned until 2 p.m. on Monday, May 2, 2011.

Declares that when the Senate recesses or adjourns on any day from Thursday, April 14, 2011, through Friday, April 29, 2011, it stand recessed or adjourned until noon on Monday, May 2, 2011.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Declares that when the House adjourns on the legislative day of Friday, April 15, 2011, or Saturday, April 16, 2011, it stand adjourned until 2 p.m. on Monday, May 2, 2011.

Declares that when the Senate recesses or adjourns on any day from Thursday, April 14, 2011, through Friday, April 29, 2011, it stand recessed or adjourned until noon on Monday, May 2, 2011.

bill.title: Providing for a conditional adjournment of the House of Representatives and a conditional recess or adjournment of the Senate.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
